bib_record.title: -NEUTRON-NEUTRON SCATTERING LENGTH IN THE REACTION 9BE(N,NN)8BE AT 10.3 MEV.

free_txt: BOCHUM DYNAMITRON-TANDEM ACCELERATOR, WITH DEU-
TERIUM BEAM PULSES OF 1.2 NS DURATION AT 5 MHZ REPE-
TITION RATE.

0.free_text: SCATTERING LENGTH FOR THE SINGLET NEUTRON-NEUTRON INTERACTION, DETERMINED FROM THE FINAL-STATE INTERACTION OF THE TWO NEUTRONS IN THE EXIT CHANNEL OF THE REACTION (4-BE-9(N,2N)4-BE-8-GS).

free_txt: .THE N-N SCATTERING LENGTH WAS DETERMINED BY COMPARING
THE EXPERIMENTAL DATA WITH A MONTE CARLO SIMULATION,
IN WHICH THE WATSON-MIGDAL MODEL WAS USED. IN THE
SIMULATION, THE EFFECTS OF FINITE GEOMETRY, ENERGY
RESOLUTION AND MULTIPLE SCATTERING IN THE TARGET, WERE
CONSIDERED. THE EFFECTIVE RANGE PARAMETER, R-NN, WAS
ASSUMED TO BE 2.65 FM.
.DATA WERE CORRECTED FOR DEADTIME, AND FOR BACKGROUND
BY FITTING A POLYNOMIAL OUTSIDE THE KINEMATICAL BAND.
THE EMITTED NEUTRONS WERE DETECTED IN FOUR
NE213 LIQUID SCINTILLATORS, ARRANGED IN TWO IDENTICAL
ARMS AT 30 DEGREES ON EITHER SIDE OF THE BEAM. EACH
ARM CONSISTED OF TWO DETECTORS, ONE ANNULAR DETECTOR,
40 MM THICK AND WITH INNER/OUTER DIAMETERS OF 120/140
MM, AND ONE STANDARD DETECTOR, 180 MM IN DIAMETER BY
80 MM THICK. THE DETECTORS IN EITHER ARM WERE PLACED
AT 1 AND 2 M FROM THE SAMPLE, RESPECTIVELY. THIS
ARRANGEMENT ALLOWED MEASUREMENT AT LOW N-N RELATIVE
ENERGIES. THE DETECTORS WERE HOUSED IN MASSIVE SHIEL-
DINGS CONSISTING OF BRASS, STEEL AND WATER. THE
EFFICIENCIES OF THE DETECTORS WERE MEASURED BY THE
ASSOCIATED PARTICLE METHOD AS WELL AS BY UTILIZING A
252-CF FISSION SOURCE. A NEUTRON FLUX MONITOR WAS
POSITIONED IN THE BEAM DIRECTION.
TOTAL ERROR.
BOCHUM DYNAMITRON-TANDEM ACCELERATOR, WITH DEU-
TERIUM BEAM PULSES OF 1.2 NS DURATION AT 5 MHZ REPE-
TITION RATE.
A PULSED BEAM OF 10.3 MEV (FWHM 0.6 MEV) NEU-
TRONS WAS PRODUCED BY THE D-D REACTION, USING A DEU-
TERIUM GAS TARGET. THE AVERAGE INTENSITY WAS 5E+6 PER
SECOND.
THE ENERGIES OF THE EMITTED NEUTRONS WERE DE-
TERMINED WITH TIME-OF-FLIGHT TECHNIQUES.
NEUTRON-GAMMA DISCRIMINATION WAS APPLIED.
.A DISC-SHAPED 2 INCH DIAMETER BY 0.5 INCH THICK METAL-
LIC BERYLLIUM TARGET WAS USED.
.DATA TAKEN FROM MAIN REF.
.DATA TAKEN FROM MAIN REF.
